005
006package gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath;
007
008import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.IItem;
009import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.atomic.IAnyAtomicItem;
010import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.function.IArrayItem;
011import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.metapath.item.function.IMapItem;
012import gov.nist.secauto.metaschema.core.util.ObjectUtils;
013
014import java.util.stream.Stream;
015
016import edu.umd.cs.findbugs.annotations.NonNull;
017
018/**
019 * A data value that can be a value in a Metapath array or map.
020 */
021public interface ICollectionValue {
022  /**
023   * Get the collection value as a sequence.
024   * <p>
025   * If the value is already a sequence, the value is returned as a sequence.
026   * Otherwise, if the value is an item, a new sequence will be created containing
027   * only that item.
028   *
029   * @return the resulting sequence
030   */
031  // TODO: rename to toSequence and resolve conflicting methods?
032  @NonNull
033  default ISequence<?> toSequence() {
034    return this instanceof ISequence
035        // return the sequence
036        ? (ISequence<?>) this
037        // return the item as a new sequence
038        : ISequence.of((IItem) this);
039  }
040
041  /**
042   * Get the collection value as a sequence.
043   * <p>
044   * If the value is already a sequence, the value is returned as a sequence.
045   * Otherwise, if the value is an item, what is returned depends on the item
046   * type:
047   * <ul>
048   * <li>{@link IArrayItem} or {@link IMapItem}: the contents of the returned
049   * sequence are the items of the array. Any member values that are a sequence
050   * are flattened.</li>
051   * <li>Any other item: A singleton sequence is returned containing the
052   * item.</li>
053   * </ul>
054   *
055   * @return the resulting sequence
056   */
057  // TODO: rename to toSequence and resolve conflicting methods?
058  @NonNull
059  ISequence<?> contentsAsSequence();
060
061  /**
062   * Get the stream of items for the collection value.
063   * <p>
064   * If the collection value is a sequence, then the items in the collection are
065   * returned.
066   *
067   * @param value
068   *          the collection value
069   * @return the sequence of related items
070   */
071  @NonNull
072  static Stream<? extends IItem> normalizeAsItems(@NonNull ICollectionValue value) {
073    return value instanceof IItem
074        ? ObjectUtils.notNull(Stream.of((IItem) value))
075        : value.toSequence().stream();
076  }
077
078  /**
079   * Produce a stream of atomic items based on the atomic value of these items.
080   * <p>
081   * Supports <a href="https://www.w3.org/TR/xpath-31/#id-atomization">item
082   * atomization</a>.
083   *
084   * @return a stream of atomized atomic items.
085   */
086  @NonNull
087  Stream<IAnyAtomicItem> atomize();
088
089  /**
090   * Get the stream of items for the collection value.
091   * <p>
092   * If the collection value contains items, then these items are returned.
093   *
094   * @return a stream of related items
095   */
096  @NonNull
097  Stream<? extends IItem> flatten();
098
099  /**
100   * Get a representation of the value based on its type signature.
101   *
102   * @return the signature
103   */
104  @NonNull
105  String toSignature();
106}
